intro: Acinodendron alatum, commonly known as the winged acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive winged stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family.
